author: @Jimenez7Diego
title: The reasons why Federico Cin√† has made history at the Miami Open 2025
text:
Streaming ATP Miami live tennis
üéæ Thiago Seyboth Wild vs Quentin Halys
* You can watch and bet on this match live here..
Something big may be brewing in the world of tennis right now, with Federico Cin√† being a strong contender to join the list of players called to do important things in the future. At just 17 years old and after reaching his first final in a Challenger tournament, the Italian defeated Comesa√±a at the Miami Open 2025, achieving some astonishing precocity records.
Tennis runs in his veins, and he can convey sensations of power and a budding champion that are not common in a 17-year-old. Federico Cin√† has claimed his first ATP victory at one of the most important stages on the global tennis calendar, the Miami Open 2025. He achieved this win against the current world No. 67, Francisco Comesa√±a, overcoming untimely cramps when he was one game away from winning the match, after putting forward all the arguments that make him one of the great promises of world tennis.
- Federico Cin√† is the son of a prestigious Italian coach
With a much more agile mobility than his notable stature suggests, the Italian is a player of the future in the present, a giant who moves swiftly across the court, executing levers that give unprecedented speed to his shots, while also displaying tactical intelligence and a disposition to endure from the baseline that are unusual for someone his age. He has become the first player born in 2007 to win a match in a Masters 1000, with a record of 10 victories and 1 loss so far this year, ensuring his entry into the top 400 next week.
Federico CINA'üáÆüáπ is the first player born in 2007 to win a match in a 1000 tournament.
‚Äî Luca Brancher (@LucaBeck)[pic.twitter.com/1gdxKPHlVC][March 19, 2025]
He breathed in tennis from a young age as the son of Francesco Cin√†, who was a coach for years to Roberta Vinci. A renowned coach in Italy, Federico's father owns his own academy in Palermo, the Cin√† Tennis Institute, where the young player grew up under the watchful eye of his father. His serve is disruptive, showing offensive will and an outstanding forehand, as well as a very reliable backhand that gives away very little, executing interesting directional changes effortlessly.
- Cin√† is the 15th youngest to win a match in a Masters 1000 in history
He has room for improvement in physical aspects and in the power of his shots, but the maturity to manage emotions and tactical intelligence he displays present him as an example of triumphant precocity, suggesting the emergence of a generational talent. Proof of this is that he is the 15th youngest player in history to win his first match in a Masters 1000, achieving it ahead of Alcaraz and just a few days before Sinner and Fonseca did.
He will try to enjoy the experience of facing a legend of the current circuit, such as Grigor Dimitrov, who will be his next opponent at the Miami Open 2025. "I'm exhausted but very happy. I couldn't even move due to cramps, but I kept fighting until the end. I wasn't going to give up. I'm very excited to face Dimitrov," stated a Federico Cin√† who promises intense emotions on the circuit in the near future.
üìä Les plus jeunes joueurs au moment de remporter leur premier match en Masters 1000 :

author: Divya Vakkalanka
title: Asian American Health Initiative Awards $1.5 Million to 14 Community Programs
text:
The Montgomery County Asian American Health Initiative (AAHI), a program under the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), has awarded $1.5 million in grants to 14 community programs. The funding from the Healthy Communities Fund will support culturally and linguistically appropriate health and social support services for Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) communities in the county.
The AAPI community in Montgomery County makes up 15 percent of the population. AAPI residents come from diverse cultural, linguistic and socioeconomic backgrounds, making tailored health and social support services essential to meet the diverse needs of this community.
This is the third year AAHI has administered the Healthy Communities Fund with the Primary Care Coalition (PCC). In past years, AAHI and partner organizations reached more than 15,300 individuals and hosted 835 community events and facilitated over 16,000 hours of volunteer service, valued at more than $400,000.
‚ÄúOur County‚Äôs diversity is one of our greatest strengths, and it is essential that we support culturally relevant services for our Asian American and Pacific Islander communities,‚Äù said County Executive Marc Elrich. ‚ÄúThe Healthy Communities Fund is a vital resource that enables us to collaborate with trusted community organizations to deliver services that effectively reach and impact these communities. We are committed to ensuring every resident in Montgomery County has access to meaningful and supportive health care.‚Äù
AAHI introduced several process enhancements to increase equity and strengthen the capabilities of applicant‚Äôs this year. The improvements included strategy consultations for interested applicants, an applicant interview phase and consultations with a data expert for awardees to support outcome measurement and reporting. These steps aimed to increase the capacity of organizations to apply, advocate for funding effectively and create systems to track their impact.
26 proposals were submitted, requesting more than $2.9 million in funding and 14 received grants to provide services from October to June 2025.
The following organizations received funding:
American Diversity Group ‚Äì $142,260.00 Asian American LEAD ‚Äì $117,790.84 Chinese American Community Health Services ‚Äì $123,053.00 Chinese Culture and Community Service Inc. ‚Äì $149,500.00 Hepatitis B Initiative of Washington, D.C. Inc. ‚Äì $109,023.05 Islamic Center of Maryland ‚Äì $66,030.00 Korean Community Service Center of Greater Washington ‚Äì $148,528.80 Manna Food Center, Inc. ‚Äì $125,685.62 Maryland Vietnamese Mutual Association, Inc. ‚Äì $147,807.59 Montgomery County Muslim Foundation ‚Äì $50,000.00 Muslim Community Center, Inc DBA ‚ÄúMCC Medical Clinic‚Äù ‚Äì $45,000.00 Philippine Nurses Association of Metro DC ‚Äì $47,180.00 Small Things Matter, Inc. ‚Äì $87,741.10 Vietnamese American Services ‚Äì $140,400.00 For more information about the Healthy Communities Fund, visit the AAHI website .

author: Jean-Charles Lajoie
title: Josh Anderson est un vrai guerrier - TVA Sports
text:
Ce serait tr√®s facile de glorifier Lane Hutson. Le livreur en mobylette est sensationnel, rien de moins.
Il va rejoindre et d√©passer le l√©gendaire Nicklas Lidstrom et devenir le d√©tenteur du record pour le plus grand nombre de mentions d‚Äôaide pour un d√©fenseur de premi√®re ann√©e dans l‚Äôhistoire de la Ligue nationale de hockey.
Ce sera un peu plus ardu, mais il pourrait rejoindre et d√©passer Chris Chelios et devenir la recrue en d√©fense avec le plus grand nombre de points de l‚Äôhistoire du Canadien de Montr√©al. Chelios avait amass√© 64 points en 1984-1985, et ce, en 74 matchs. Il avait 22 ans et a eu 23 ans en cours de saison. Hutson vient tout juste d‚Äôavoir 21 ans...
Bref, je pourrai facilement vous parler de Hutson pendant longtemps. Je pourrais faire de m√™me avec Nick Suzuki, qui a toujours su √©lever son jeu d‚Äôun cran lorsque la situation le commandait et qui encore mardi soir a pris les choses en mains alors que le CH disputait un match horrible apr√®s 40 minutes de jeu.
Suzuki a sonn√© la charge en troisi√®me p√©riode, r√©coltant au passage le but vainqueur. Bravo √† Martin St-Louis pour la pr√©sence du capitaine sur la deuxi√®me vague de jeu de puissance. Que Martin l‚Äôa fait expr√®s ou non, bravo √† Martin.
Avec le Storm de Guelph en 2019, Suzuki a √©t√© exceptionnel, notamment face au Spirit de Saginaw en demi-finale. Le Storm tirait de l‚Äôarri√®re 3 √† 1 dans la s√©rie et Nick a montr√© le chemin en route vers un gain en sept et un championnat remport√© lors de la finale. Suzuki a cumul√© 42 points, dont 24 buts en 28 matchs, lors des s√©ries de la OHL en 2019 et Marc Bergevin se pin√ßait pour √™tre certain de ne pas r√™ver, lui qui privil√©giait obtenir Cody Glass des Golden Knights de Vegas dans la transaction impliquant Max Pacioretty. Bergevin se trompait royalement, mais le DG des Knights aussi.
Il me serait tr√®s facile de vous parler de Suzuki, de Cole Caufield, de Samuel Montembeault, de Hutson ou encore de St-Louis, qui ne re√ßoit vraiment pas assez de cr√©dit pour les succ√®s du Canadien actuellement. J‚Äôai plut√¥t envie de vous parler de Josh Anderson, le futur gagnant du troph√©e Jacques-Beauchamps remis √† la quatri√®me √©toile de la saison chez le Tricolore. Il ne l‚Äôaura pas vol√©. L‚Äôimpact d‚ÄôAnderson sur le groupe de joueurs du CH est exponentiel cette saison.
Voil√† un gars qui √©tait tout m√™l√© depuis tr√®s longtemps. Il √©tait perdu dans les demandes et les sch√©mas de son coach, en plus d‚Äô√™tre malheureux au milieu d‚Äôun groupe dans lequel il ne se reconnaissait plus.
Un ailier de puissance en totale perte de confiance, impuissant devant son incapacit√© de comprendre ou voulait aller St-Louis et d√©prim√© devant le constat qu‚Äôil n‚Äôe√ªt pas ce qu‚Äôil fallait pour faire ≈ìuvre utile. Anderson, dont on voulait tous voir le contrat rachet√© l‚Äô√©t√© dernier. J‚Äôai d‚Äôailleurs √©t√© le premier d√©√ßu de constater que ce vulgaire boulet se pr√©sentait au tournoi de golf de l‚Äô√©quipe.
Je peux maintenant affirmer que je ne me passerais pas d‚ÄôAnderson et que tout le cr√©dit revient d‚Äôabord √† Anderson lui-m√™me. Le gars s‚Äôest pris en mains et a d√©cid√© d‚Äôessayer vraiment.
Anderson a donc √©cout√© et il s‚Äôest ajust√©. Cr√©dit second, mais total au coach qui a trouv√© les mots et qui est entr√© sous la peau d‚ÄôAnderson, ce qui semblait √™tre une mission impossible avant cette saison.
St-Louis a ensuite trouv√© une combinaison parfaite. Le trio des trois boulets, Dvorak, Gallagher et Anderson, est devenu le trio le plus constant et le plus fiable du CH. Un troisi√®me trio qui dans les faits est un excellent deuxi√®me trio dans cette saison de transition, de ¬´mi ¬ª qui est en train de se transformer en saison de r√™ve.
Anderson aime tellement ce qui se passe qu‚Äôil endure. Son seuil de tol√©rance √† la douleur lui m√©rite honneurs et distinctions. C‚Äôest Anderson en 2025, comme c‚Äô√©tait Shea Weber en 2021.
Un gars d√©mont√©, disloqu√©, magan√© pas mal plus que Dave dans Slap Shot. Anderson a besoin de deux √† quatre heures de traitement par jour, qu‚Äôil y ait match ou non. Il encaisse avec bonheur et plaisir. Il est heureux et veut faire partie de la belle histoire.
Anderson est inspirant et ses co√©quipiers se servent de lui pour mieux r√™ver √©veill√©s, pour mieux avancer. Quand il est entr√© t√™te premi√®re dans la bande, je me suis dit : ¬´√áa y est, il est mort¬ª. Pourtant en troisi√®me p√©riode, il √©tait de retour au banc. Anderson a tout mon respect et je m‚Äôexcuse de m‚Äô√™tre emport√© contre lui, c‚Äôest un vrai guerrier!

author: @WLOX
title: Amateur ham radio operators prepare for emergencies with field day
text: GULFPORT, Miss. (WLOX) - When emergency events take place, phone service could be dropped across the Coast. The Mississippi Coast Amateur Radio Association (MCARA) is prepared for that exact scenario. On Saturday, members of the MCARA practiced setting up and making communications as part of a field day. ‚ÄúWe take time to share our knowledge and develop relationships in case you need them later on, perhaps in an emergency,‚Äù said MCARA coordinator Steven Harrison. Hurricanes are an example of when ham radio communication is critical. ‚ÄúIf you remember Hurricane Katrina, I was on my roof with my cell phone holding it up in the air trying to get in touch with anybody,‚Äù explains Harrison. ‚ÄúWith ham radio, all you have to do is pull your radio out and call, and a group like this is going to have somebody listening.‚Äù Other groups like this around the country are also taking part in the 24-hour field day activity to make as many contacts as possible. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve made contacts so far with groups in Oklahoma, Texas, Florida, Alabama, Mississippi and as far as Oregon,‚Äù Harrison said. While radio communication can be important in an emergency, it‚Äôs also a fun hobby. ‚ÄúHam radio is communicating not using your telephone or wires and radio frequencies,‚Äù said Harrison. ‚ÄúWhen you were younger, you might have used walkie-talkies too. Ham radio is for people who want to buy more capable, probably more expensive walkie-talkies. It‚Äôs fun to be able to do that and say, ‚ÄòYeah, I can talk to the world.‚Äô‚Äù The field day event continues until Sunday afternoon. If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about the Mississippi Coast Amateur Radio Association, you can visit their Facebook page . See a spelling or grammar error in this story? Report it to our team HERE . Copyright 2024 WLOX. All rights reserved.

title: CA Electrical Group Revolutionizes Residential Electrical Services in San Jose | Markets | bigspringherald.com
text:
San Jose, CA - CA Electrical Group, a leading electrical services provider based in San Jose, is proud to announce its exceptional residential electrician services. With a team of highly skilled and experienced electricians, CA Electrical Group is committed to delivering top-notch electrical solutions to homeowners in San Jose and the surrounding areas.
Home electrical systems play a crucial role in ensuring the safety, functionality, and comfort of residences. CA Electrical Group understands the importance of reliable and efficient electrical services, and their team of residential electricians is equipped with the knowledge and expertise to handle a wide range of electrical projects.
Whether it's installing new electrical fixtures, upgrading electrical panels, or troubleshooting electrical issues, CA Electrical Group's residential electricians are dedicated to providing superior craftsmanship and exceptional customer service. They work closely with homeowners to understand their specific electrical needs and provide customized solutions that meet their requirements.
"CA Electrical Group is excited to bring our expertise and exceptional service to homeowners in San Jose," said Idan Ben Moshe the CEO at CA Electrical Group. "We understand that electrical projects can be complex and require professional expertise. Our team of residential electricians is committed to delivering high-quality workmanship, reliable solutions, and excellent customer service to ensure that homeowners' electrical systems are safe, efficient, and up to code."
CA Electrical Group takes pride in its attention to detail, prompt response times, and transparent communication throughout every project. Their residential electricians utilize the latest tools, techniques, and industry best practices to ensure that all electrical work is performed to the highest standards.
For more information about CA Electrical Group's expert residential electrician services or to schedule a consultation, please visit https://caelectricalgroup.com/ - https://caelectricalgroup.wordpress.com/2023/12/28/press-release-nov-electrician-maintenance/ or contact us at (669) 260-0712.
About CA Electrical Group:
CA Electrical Group is a trusted electrical services provider based in San Jose, CA. With a team of highly skilled residential electricians, they specialize in meeting the electrical needs of homeowners in San Jose and surrounding areas. Committed to excellence, CA Electrical Group is known for delivering top-quality workmanship, exceptional customer service, and reliable solutions.
